quotes.message: There is still no cure for the common birthday.
quotes.name: John Glenn

quotes.message: Middle age is the time when a man is always thinking that in a week or two he will feel as good as ever.
quotes.name: Don Marquis

quotes.message: Middle age is when your age starts to show around your middle.
quotes.name: Bob Hope

quotes.message: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
quotes.name: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.message: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
quotes.name: Lucile Ball

quotes.message: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: We know we're getting old when the only thing we want for our birthday is not to be reminded of it.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: A birthday is just the first day of another 365-day journey around the sun. Enjoy the trip.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: One to-day is worth two to-morrows.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: I'm sixty years of age. That's 16 Celsius.
quotes.name: George Carlin

quotes.message: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
quotes.name: Jonathan Swift

quotes.message: Grow old along with me! The best is yet to be, the last of life, for which the first was made.
quotes.name: Robert Browning

quotes.message: I'm at an age when my back goes out more than I do.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: If we could be twice young and twice old we could correct all our mistakes.
quotes.name: Euripides

quotes.message: Time and Tide wait for no man, but time always stands still for a woman of thirty.
quotes.name: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.message: What most persons consider as virtue, after the age of 40 is simply a loss of energy.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: Every man over forty is a scoundrel.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: The years between fifty and seventy are the hardest. You are always being asked to do things, and yet you are not decrepit enough to turn them down.
quotes.name: T S Eliot
